item.content:encoded:
A good pair of hiking socks is a must for tackling trails. Naturally, you’ll want to choose a style that’s soft and moisture-wicking in order to prevent chafing and blisters. Depending on the season, you can also choose from socks of varying thickness to help keep feet extra warm or cool. Not sure where to start? We’re here to help. Below, we’ve rounded up the best hiking socks for men and women to add to your wardrobe now, from plush cotton styles to options made with adaptive merino wool that are perfect for all sorts of weather conditions. Read on to shop them all.

These ultra-durable socks are made with temperature-regulating merino wool to keep you cool in summer and warm in winter. They're even a favorite among Danish mountaineer and trail runner Rasmus Kragh, who has successfully tackled Mount Everest.

Pros: These socks also amp up comfort via moderate cushioning in the heel and forefoot and seamless toe design to prevent blisters. They also feature ribbed support in the leg, so they won’t bunch or slip down and cause uncomfortable rubbing inside your hiking boot. On top of all that, they’re made with a high-density knit to withstand tough and frequent wear and come in sizes for both men and women.

Cons: These tend to run large and should be line dried.

Great for everything from rigorous hikes to everyday walks, these cotton-blend socks offer lightweight support in a range of fun, colorful designs.

Pros: For added comfort, they feature cushioning in the ball of the foot and heel, arch support and a compression top to prevent the socks from slipping down. They come as a value pack with two or five socks. Plus, they’re machine washable and dryer safe for easy maintenance.

Cons: Some users may find these too warm to wear on summer hikes and the toe seam is uncomfortable.

If your feet tend to get sweaty, these socks are a must. They’re equipped with breathable mesh and antimicrobial fabric to help keep your feet cool and fresh-smelling.

Pros: The socks also feature cushioning in the heel and forefoot and a lightly compressive top with a double ribbed design on the cuff for extra security. What’s more, they’re reinforced with terry cloth on the heel and toe areas to reduce wear and tear. They’re also fairly thick, so they can be worn in cooler conditions, although maybe not sub-freezing temperatures. They come as a value pack of five and are also available in a variety of bright colors.

Cons: These are not dryer-safe (they tend to shrink if not lined dry).

These socks are also made with super-soft, breathable merino wool, which regulates the body's temperature to keep your feet from overheating.

Pros: They're blended with nylon to ensure they're itch-free and polyester for increased durability. Meanwhile, a hint of spandex adds stretch for ultimate comfort. The footbed is fully cushioned to absorb impact. These come in a value pack of 3.

Cons: If you have larger calves, they may feel slightly tight.

These merino wool socks have smooth toe construction to prevent irritation and shaped cushioning in the footbed for extra comfort.

Pros: Elasticized arches offer support and stability. The toes and heels are reinforced for long-lasting wear. They come in a pack of 4 with various colors.

Cons: They may shrink if left in the drier for too long.

These socks feature a breathable, moisture-wicking blend of combed cotton and polyester with just a bit of spandex for improved stretch.

Pros: These socks are reinforced with high-density fibers and pile cushioning underfoot to prevent blisters and boost overall comfort. Elastic in the arch offers added support. They come in multiple sizes and colors. This value pack includes five pairs.

Cons: They may shed a bit.

These Smartwool merino wool socks are blended with nylon and elastic for improved durability and fit.

Pros: An arch brace holds the sock in place and adds additional support while a flat-knit toe seam minimizes friction. Moderate cushioning underfoot absorbs impact. Mesh zones throughout promote breathability. They come in a range of sizes and colors.

Cons: They may run big.

item.content:encoded:
Sitting in a desk chair or airplane seat for long periods of time can cause your legs and feet to become stiff, sore and swell due to lack of circulation. Footrests offer a great solution to the problem. Available in plastic, wood and foam styles, they elevate your feet to improve blood flow and prevent fatigue. They also provide firm support to encourage better posture, which in turn can help reduce soreness in the back, legs and knees.

Even beyond their health benefits, footrests are great for petite individuals whose feet may not hit the ground while sitting. Many are often tilt-adjustable to accommodate a range of body sizes and heights. From sleek options for under the desk to slings designed specifically for in-flight travel, we’ve rounded up the best footrests on the market to fit a range of needs and budgets. Read on to shop them all.

Ideal for work, home or travel, this velvety cushion can be used with bare or socked feet and is super-soft to the touch.

Pros: The design comes with a nonslip bottom to keep the unit firmly in place, plus a removable cover that's machine washable for easy cleanup. The crescent-shaped cushion has a flat base; it can also be flipped over to become a rocker if you prefer to keep feet moving. At 3.9 inches tall, it provides just the right amount of elevation to maximize comfort for people of all heights. It's also much lighter to carry than other freestanding styles, making it great to carry when you're on the go.

Cons: Due to its plush exterior, the unit may make feet warm — so it may not be for summer use.

This footrest features ergonomic pedals made of comfortable Velboa and 30D high-density sponge.

Pros: It has a non-slip bottom and the cover is machine washable.

Cons: The firmness may decrease after months of putting pressure on it.

Designed to be used with or without shoes, this plastic under-desk footrest tilts back and forth so your legs can stretch as you work.

Pros: All you have to do is apply light pressure to the unit to adjust it to your desired positioning so you can perform everything from lower-leg to full-leg stretches. The design also features a textured surface for a massagelike feel on the soles of bare or socked feet. While looks aren't necessarily crucial when it comes to footrests, this design is sleek enough to easily blend in with your decor — complete with a low-profile silhouette finished in black.

Cons: The height of the unit isn't adjustable, so it may be too low to the ground to support people with shorter legs (it's only 3.4 inches tall, as opposed to the average 3.9-4-inches for many styles).

This model has a textured surface made up of geometric circular bumps for enhanced stress reduction.

Pros: It comes fully assembled. It offers three adjustable height positions and tilts from -30 degrees to +30 degrees, allowing you to find the most comfortable angle for you.

Cons: It may slide around a bit.

Specifically designed to provide ample clearance under desks, this supportive, four-inch tall cushion could work just about anywhere. Plus, it's made of an antimicrobial and hypoallergenic foam to prevent odor buildup.

Pros: The bottom of the unit features a microbead tread to subtly massage feet and prevent the unit from shifting when placed upright. Meanwhile, the design can also be flipped over to act as a roller. To help keep the velour fabric fresh, the cover is removable and machine washable.

Cons: The zipper is on the bottom of the unit, and it might dig into hardwood floors.

This footrest is made with 100% memory foam and has an orthopedic teardrop design, which places your feet and legs in a more comfortable and ergonomically correct position.

Pros: A non-slip gel rubber bottom ensures it always stays in place. The ultra-soft, durable velour cover is removable and machine washable.

Cons: Some may prefer a firmer footrest.

This footrest features curved feet with anti-slip grips on the bottom that let it roll and tilt without slipping or sliding.

Pros: It's crafted with heavy-duty Lauan hardwood plywood for long-lasting strength and reliable durability.

Cons: The grippy surface may be hard to clean.

item.content:encoded:
Cold feet will be a nuisance come winter. Your piggies might feel numb or hard or just plain icy to the touch. The problem typically occurs when temperatures drop, which makes your body respond by pumping blood to the most vital organs. This causes a change in blood flow to areas like your feet and hands, which results in the type of cold feeling you want to avoid. That’s why maintaining a bit of warmth from ankle to heel will help keep your feet comfortable. As a bonus, when your feet are warm, other parts of your body reap the benefits, too. Heating products can also improve relaxation, so invest in a foot warmer. Let’s not forget that incorporating a foot warmer can help you save money as you might consider turning off room and home heaters. Below, we’ve curated some of the best foot warmers on the market with you in mind.

At 22 inches wide and 21 inches deep, it's big enough to accommodate two pairs of feet. The 15-inch cover featuring ultra-plush fabric protects your shins from cold air.

Pros: Both sides are constructed from luxuriously soft, thick flannel that is exceptionally durable and warm. The cord is 10-feet long and a 2-hour auto-off helps you save energy and prevent excessive heating. It has 3 heat settings.

Cons: Some may find since it's so roomy, cold air can get in sometimes.

There's room for two people (that's four feet) under this product's roomy pad pocket. It will ease sore muscles and can be used around different parts of your body, including the neck, shoulders, back and legs.

Pros: A mixture of micromink and polyester means the material is extra-soft. This heating pad comes with an LCD controller with four different levels. It automatically shuts off after continuous use for 2 hours to prevent overheating. Best of all, it comes with a 30-day satisfaction guarantee.

Cons: Though it's safe for the washing machine, consider hand-washing to maintain quality.

This electric foot warmer has a soft fleece cover and heats up when you plug it in for just 12 to 15 minutes. It comes with water in a pre-sealed pouch that heats up, from 140 degrees to 158 degrees Fahrenheit.

Pros: This also has a built-in auto shut-off function and a non-skid bottom. It fits women's feet up to size 14 and men's size 13. It should stay warm for up to 5 hours at a time.

Cons: The water may get too hot for some so you should wear socks.

The foot warmer is an energy-efficient, low-watt device that warms your feet just as well as its competitors, but won't overload your electric circuits with its cost-cutting tech.

Pros: Three adjustable positions allow you to use it as a heater when positioned upright, and it can also be used as a foot stool or heated mat. You can use it with your shoes on or barefoot. The design is attractive enough to use in the office or at home.

Cons: Some thick shoes might not be able to transfer the heat to your feet as well as minimalist options.

This heat therapy foot massager is made with a super-soft polyester top cover that's removable and has a non-slip bottom.

Pros: It has eight rotating shiatsu rollers that offer a deep tissue kneading massage. The top cover can be detached so you can use the unit as a heating pad, back massager or heated seat cushion. It also comes in a PU leather option.

Cons: It automatically shuts off after just 15 minutes.

You simply shake these to activate them and they'll warm up in 15-30 minutes.

Pros: They're easily disposable with no ingredients that will harm the environment. They come in packs of 2, 3, 5 or 16.

Cons: You may need to wear looser boots with these.

You simply put these plush booties in the microwave for 60 seconds and they provide warmth for the whole foot.

Pros: They're scented with lavender and fit adult foot sizes 6-10.

Cons: They're not washable.

item.content:encoded:
Wet boots are uncomfortable, but they can take up to a full day to air-dry. Thankfully, boot dryers are a great alternative. These handy machines can dry boots or shoes in just a few hours, so you’re ready to comfortably take on your next adventure. The best options operate with a fan, which makes them especially efficient and helps keep foul-smelling bacteria at bay. Many are built to dry two to four pairs at once and can work with a range of materials like leather, fleece and neoprene. Of course, check the particular dryer to ensure your shoes are compatible with the unit. You can also opt for a compact, foldable option if your floor space is limited. Considering all this, we’ve compiled some of the best boot dryers we could find in every category.

The unit features two removable extension tubes to fit boots up to 16 inches tall. For especially fast results, the dryer can spew out heat up to 105 degrees Fahrenheit.

Pros: One of the key selling points of this item is its noticeably compact design, which makes it easier to store in your home. It also comes with a three-hour timer so you can set the dry time to your liking, plus an optional heat switch that can dry items with or without heat. In addition to drying footwear, the machine is also safe to use on liners and clothes (with no shrinkage or damage to delicate items). It comes with a six-inch power cord for easy maneuverability and a one-year warranty, just in case you're not fully satisfied with your purchase.

Cons: This unit tends to be noisy.

Like the Maxxdry, this option includes two removable extension tubes to accommodate boots up to 16 inches tall, a three-hour timer and a heat or no-heat switch.

Pros: It's also able to heat up to 105 degrees Fahrenheit and is safe to use on clothes and liners. Plus, it comes with a one-year warranty in case the unit is damaged.

Cons: The unit tends to tip over when used with heavy ski boots. Items tend to take longer to dry with this machine, typically within a few hours.

This two-shoe dryer is safe to use on all footwear. It's made to fully dry shoes within three to eight hours, all while using less electricity than a standard light bulb thanks to thermal convention.

Pros: It's also designed to be silent and comes with a 25-year warranty.

Cons: It doesn't come with an on/off switch.

Kendal's dryer can be set with an up to three hours timer with low and high-temperature modes. It uses tubes with warm air and aroma active carbon to reduce odor.

Pros: This dryer can dry 2 pairs of shoes at the same time and also comes with a separate glove drying apparatus for versatile use. It weighs 3.5-pounds and comes with an added wall mount so it is lightweight and takes up less space in smaller areas.

Cons: It can't be mounted or placed near any flammable object like cushions or curtains.

With a constant 106 degree Farhenheit temperature, this dryer airs without causing damage to your shoe with an adjustable distance between the two stretched brackets.

Pros: It dries most materials including leather, rubber, PVC, neoprene, cloth, fleece, felt, canvas, synthetics and fabrics. It has a portable, fold-up design so you can bring it along with you to your next outdoor event from camping to sports.

Cons: The brand advises to not put "soaked" or "dripping wet" shoes directly on the dryer.

JobSite's dual-tube shoe dryer dries bulky, damp boots in eight hours and wet shoes overnight with no motor or moving parts for silent usage.

Pros: This drier uses warm thermal air that rises naturally as to not shrink the boot. It naturally deodorizes and prevents odors caused by perspiration. The sturdy base allows you to dry insulated boots, work boots, rain boots and more with a two-year warranty as well.

Cons: The dry cycle time may be too long for anyone in need of dry shoes in a hurry.

OdorStop's dryer is designed to permanently remove odor from shoes with featuring an added deodorizer function.

Pros: This dryer can dry a single pair of boots and features adjustable tubes to dry boots of different heights. It also includes a high output fan and a three-hour timer with an optional constant setting. The heat and deodorizer function can be used separately, so you can save energy if you just need to freshen up already dry pairs.

Cons: The brand warns that the deodorizer may omit a strong smell and should be used when you're not in the room.

item.content:encoded:
Stinky feet can be annoying and embarrassing. They’re caused by bacteria and fungi, which can fester in shoes and leave behind an unpleasant stench. Thankfully, all hope is not lost if your favorite pairs have become odiferous. A deodorizer will neutralize and prevent foul odor from forming, so you’ll never have to worry about taking your shoes off in public again. To help make your shopping a little easier, we’ve rounded up some of the best options on the market for instant freshness — including sprays, powders and solid deodorizers you can pop in your bag on the go. Read on to discover them all.

This maximum strength spray features essential oils to fight bacteria that cause odors.

Pros: Available in a refreshing lemon and eucalyptus scent, this spray doesn't leave behind a residue and only takes one to two sprays per shoe to effectively mask odors.

Cons: The smell may be overpowering at first.

The nozzle on Sof Sole's bottle allows for two different ways to spray your shoes to get unique angles and hard to reach crevices.

Pros: The formula of this spray does not discolor or leave behind film or residue for long-lasting coverage. It is safe on mesh, leather, canvas, suede and more.

Cons: Bottle may be smaller in person than it appears online.

 

This all-natural powder is safe enough to use directly on feet and great for those who want a scent-free option.

Pros: Made with zinc oxide, which prevents bacteria growth and blisters from forming, this powder is able to last up to six months with repeated application. Customers are guaranteed a full refund if the product doesn’t perform as promised.

Cons: Powder is hard to spread evenly and shouldn’t be used in open-toed shoes as it leaves behind a residue.

Elite Sportz uses seven pure essential oils and 11 helpful herbs and botanicals to create this stench-reducing spray.

Pros: This spray is also a moisturizer that goes to work controlling odors and soothing dry, cracked soles with 100% non-toxic ingredients.

Cons: The smell may be overpowered by the peppermint ingredient.

Made with 12 powerhouse essential oils and natural enzymes like apple cider vinegar, peppermint oil, tea tree oil and eucalyptus oil, Sprayzee's deodorizer is meant to eliminate any foul odor from shoes.

Pros: This aluminum-free and paraben-free product is easy on sensitive skin and uses essential oils and enzymes to alter odors on a molecular level rather than just cover them up.

Cons: The spray nozzle may clog if not cleaned properly.

Rocket Pure's deodorizer features natural and non-toxic ingredients with a lifetime guarantee policy.

Pros: This spray comes with options of mint, cedar or lemon scents so you can find the smell that most appeals to you to fix your stinky shoes.

Cons: The brand recommends to shake well before use as they use natural ingredients and some separation may occur.

These deodorizers are easy to use and can be simply dropped into the shoe of your choice and left for all-day work

Pros: They can eliminate odor for over six months and can be used in anything from a boot to a sneaker and more.

Cons: These might not sit properly in sandals on thong flip flops.

When cleaning your shoes, a simple soap and water treatment often won’t do. For finishes like a supple leather, suede and mesh, you’ll want to opt for a special shoe cleaner that will remove tough stains and renew the finish without damaging it. Below, we’ve rounded up the best shoe cleaners to suit a range of needs. We’ve included solutions perfect for all types of materials as well as one that specifically clean and restores leather. Our list also includes handy sets complete with formula and a brush, as well as spray nozzle options that allow for more even application during an all-over clean. Cons: It doesn't work as effectively on deeper stains.

Cons: This is meant solely for leather products so you may need to buy separate cleaners for other types of shoes.

This pack comes with two bottles of premium sneaker cleaning spray to bring your favorite kicks back to life.

Cons: You must remove your sneakers' laces before using this spray.

Find everything you need to fix up your shoes in Combat Cleaner's three spray bottle kit with an added shoe brush.

Pros: This set includes a shoe deodorizer to eliminate bad smells, a shoe cleaner to remove dirt and stains from your shoes and a shoe shield to repel oils and water.

Cons: The cleaner is not meant for suede shoes.

item.content:encoded:
Your feet deserve some TLC. Whether it’s hours spent standing, working out or being exposed to the elements, pampering your piggies with a foot massage can help enhance your overall mood. What’s more, a foot massager can lead to better sleep since it increases blood circulation. Daily kneading around the feet can help relieve stiffness around the ankle, too. Sessions at spas can absorb a lot of money and time, but there are several foot massage devices on the market that share the same benefits, all from the comfort of your own home. Here, we’ve selected some of the best options that will make you want to incorporate foot massages into your daily routine, from mildly intense foot relief to powerful electronic styles ideal for people who suffer from more severe pain.

Cons: The device can be squeaky to some users, so adjust the pressure you apply accordingly.

Cons: It automatically stops after 15 minutes.

Cons: This massages mostly the front of the foot, more than the heel and backside of the foot.

Nekeck's massager is equipped with six massage heads with 18 rotating massage nodes for widespread pressure.

Pros: This soothing, heating massager adjusts to three levels of height so you can use it in any setting from sitting on the couch to under your desk at the office.

Cons: It only massages the bottom of the feet.

Cons: It only fits up to a men's size 12.

item.content:encoded:
Compression socks are often recommended for diabetics, pregnant women and other people with circulatory issues, but just about anyone can wear them, as long as they’re comfortable. They offer more pressure at the ankle than the calf to support blood flow in the legs, making them ideal as well for people who spend most of their day on their feet or traveling on planes. Most compression socks are made with a blend of synthetic fabrics that provide a snug yet stretchy fit and come in a range of lengths and firmness to fit any need or preference. To help you wade through all the options, we’ve rounded up some of the best unisex styles you can buy. Read on to shop for them all.

Whether you're a runner, nurse or simply looking to improve lower leg circulation, these knee-high socks are a great pick since they wick away moisture.

Pros: These socks offer compression for those seeking a high level of support (20-30 mmHg). Constructed of a breathable nylon and spandex blend, they don’t lose compression after washing, include stay-put cuffs that don’t roll down during wear and include shock-absorbing technology.

For a slightly lower-grade compression sock (15–20 mmHg), this option offers sturdy support at an unbeatable price.

Cons: Styles may shrink after washing.

Cons: These may fit tight on wide feet.

Cons: The brand lets you know if your calf size is larger than the prescribed size. If it is, you will experience a tighter feel.

Cons: They only offered in two sizes.

From the rise of ’90s nostalgia to the new “VSCO girl” aesthetic, puka shell (also called cowrie shell) embellishments have resurfaced on the fashion scene. And it’s not hard to understand the appeal. The beach-inspired accessory adds a retro feel to any warm-weather outfit, from sundresses to jeans skirts and everything in between. Even if you wouldn’t consider your style boho, these anklets also pair well with edgier, moto-inspired outfits for an unexpected twist. What’s more, they’re also mainly in neutral hues, making them easy to pair with any outfit’s color palette. Read on to shop some of our favorite puka shell anklets that are available now.

This ankle bracelet is made with natural and gold-painted cowrie shells as well as cowrie beads and a wax cord. The 7.8-inch cord is made to stretch up to 15 inches, with a slipknot to customize the size to perfectly suit your ankle.

Pros: The adjustable detailing makes this bracelet highly versatile and likely to fit nearly anyone's ankle.

Cons: This piece likely will not double as a wrist bracelet for the average woman.

This handmade puka shell anklet is available in a variety of colors, from black and beige to those with turquoise or gold detailing. The bracelet features a sliding cord and wax twine to adjust the strap to fit your ankle.

Pros: The anklet should fit nearly any ankle size, and there are a lot of color options to choose from.

Cons: Some users may find it's slightly difficult to adjust.

The necklace and anklet are both made with natural shells, jade cords and adjustable pearl buckles. The necklace ranges from 16 to 18 inches long, and the anklet ranges from 7 to 14 inches.

Pros: The two-piece set makes this a value-packed offer. The adjustable cords make these jewelry items highly versatile and able to fit most people.

Cons: The necklace clasp might be difficult to take on and off alone, so have a friend or partner help you if necessary.

item.title: These Waterproof Adjustable Anklets Are Perfect for Vacation
item.author: Allie Fasanella

amzn:product.amzn:productSummary: This beachy Pura Vida anklet is equipped to take on rain, surfing and showering.
These braided, embellished anklets can be layered any way you like.
These waterproof anklets feature a subtle evil eye amulet, which is said to ward off misfortunate.

item.content:encoded:
If you’re looking to hit the beach and play in the surf while sporting an eye-catching anklet, it’s important that you find one that’s waterproof. Otherwise, it will likely deteriorate quickly or lose its color after you step in the ocean. Fortunately, a variety of brands make ankle bracelets that can get totally soaked and still hold up nicely. To help you find exactly what you’re looking for, we curated some of our favorite waterproof adjustable anklets featuring wax-coated strings. Each of our picks will add a pop of color to your beach look.

This anklet features blue, yellow and orange wax-coated strings and the brand's signature iron-coated copper "P" charm.

Pros: An adjustable slipknot band widens 3–6 inches to accommodate different ankle sizes.

Cons: Some may find it a little flimsy.

This set of three anklets is also made from wax-coated string. The black and gray braided ones are decorated with small coin-like charms.

Pros: You can adjust the slipknot 8–12 inches.

Cons: They may loosen after a while.

With this option, you get six simple string anklets in various colors and each has an evil eye charm.

Pros: You can adjust the sliding knot closure up to 14 inches.

Cons: Some may wish they were slightly thicker.

item.title: Stunning Transparent Sandals for Every Budget
item.author: Claudia Miller

amzn:product.amzn:productSummary: Schutz’s clear sandals are perfect for parties and formal occasions.
Able to work with both jeans and cocktail dresses, this classic style promises to be a new closet staple.
Get in on the clear heel trend without breaking the bank with a pair from Cape Robbin.

item.content:encoded:
To the editors of FN, there’s no better way to stand out from the crowd than with a bold pair of shoes. One of our latest favorite styles that fills the bill? Transparent sandals. Varying in silhouette and height, these options from Schutz, Steve Madden and more are sure to earn you compliments and double-takes anywhere you go. They all feature see-through heels and can match many outfits thanks to their neutral colors and PVC straps. Plus, they span a range of price points, so you’re bound to find a style that fits your budget nicely. Read on to find your dream pair.

Schutz's block heel mules feature two clear front straps adorned with crystal appliqués for a show-stopping look.

Pros: The heel measures four inches for leg-lengthening effects.

Cons: These run small.

Steve Madden uses PVC straps around the ankle and the toe to create this 4-inch heel.

Pros: The adjustable buckle on the ankle strap allows for a customizable fit while a rounded, thicker heel creates a stable base and a modern look.

Cons: It's suggested to size up from your normal sizing.

Complete with a 4.25-inch square heel, Cape Robbin's ankle strap sandals offer a sleek, trend-forward look.

Pros: These trendy heels come in a variety of heights and colors, all at an accessible price.

Cons: These fit narrow.

item.title: Fierce Gladiator-Style Heels to Shop for Now
item.author: Claudia Miller

amzn:product.amzn:productSummary: Aldo’s gladiator-style heels incorporate braided straps for a unique take on the trend.
The metal detailing on BCBGeneration’s cage heels make these particularly sleek.
A slightly more subtle take on the style, Calvin Klein’s heels can be easily adjusted to find the right fit for you.

item.content:encoded:
Inspired by the Greek and Roman sandals of antiquity, strappy, cage-style heels are a svelte and eye-catching shoe style. A range of brands from Calvin Klein to Aldo offer their modern takes on the look, so you can easily spice up your wardrobe for the warm weather season. Ahead, shop some of the chicest gladiator-style heels on the market. Offered in both faux and genuine leather finishes as well as colors ranging from vibrant red to deep green, there is a pair for every taste. They also look much more expensive than they actually are.

These cage-style sandals feature roped details and a 4.25-inch heel. They're a real standout when done in red.

Pros: A zipper along the heel allows for easy on and off access.

Cons: The straps are nonadjustable and may fit tighter or looser, depending on the individual foot.

BCBGeneration's leather sandals feature subtle hardware on the straps and a 4-inch covered heel.

Pros: The look can easily be dressed up or down for a range of occasions.

Cons: Colors may appear different online than in person.

These genuine leather sandals feature two supportive ankle straps with adjustable buckles and an angled 4-inch heel.

Pros: They come in forest green, silver, white and black.

Cons: The straps may shift or slide slightly when walking.

item.title: These Beaded Anklets Are The Perfect Warm Weather Accessories
item.author: Allie Fasanella

amzn:product.amzn:productSummary: This braided anklet is waterproof, making it perfect for the beach.
This colorful anklet is eye-catching and ideal for sensitive skin.
This hemp beaded anklet is simple and versatile.

item.content:encoded:
Adding an anklet to your look when you’re wearing sandals or hitting the beach barefoot is a great way to stand out. And some of the prettiest and most popular styles feature beadwork. There’s a wide variety of options on the market, so to help narrow down your choices, we rounded up some of our favorite beaded anklets to show off when it’s warm out. Each pick will complement an already vibrant outfit or amplify a simple look by adding a pop of color at the ankle. We’ve even included a waterproof braided style to withstand wear and tear on your next trip to the pool or a seaside vacation.

This anklet features wax-coated, waterproof threading and ornate silver beads.

Pros: It comes in turquoise and lavender. An adjustable slipknot design allows it to fit different ankle sizes.

Cons: The color may fade a bit after continued wear.

This anklet features multicolored glass seed beads and measures eight inches long.

Pros: The hypoallergenic 14K gold-plated extension chain is suitable for sensitive skin. It has a sturdy, reliable lobster claw clasp. These come in a pack of two.

Cons: It may be somewhat big for smaller ankles.

This 10-inch anklet features three hemp strands with an assortment of glass beads in various colors.

Pros: It has a silver-plated lobster claw clasp.

Cons: This one might also be a little big on some ankles.

item.title: Stylish Sterling Silver Anklets You’ll Never Want to Take Off
item.author: Allie Fasanella

amzn:product.amzn:productSummary: This Amazon Collection anklet is simple, delicate and built for longevity.
This sturdy anklet comes neatly packaged in a travel pouch.
This dainty anklet comes in a variety of designs to suit different preferences.

item.content:encoded:
Many jewelry designers use sterling silver, an alloy made from pure silver and other trace metals, because of its malleability and durability. When taken care of properly, sterling silver pieces can last decades. It’s even stronger than gold, and unlike other metals such as nickel and brass, sterling silver isn’t likely to irritate your skin. For these reasons, it’s a great option if you’re looking for an anklet that’ll last you more than one warm weather season. With this in mind, we curated some of our favorite sterling silver anklets on the market. They’re all accessibly priced, too, so you don’t have to spend a fortune to add these cute accessories to your wardrobe.

This intricate option offers subtle sparkle.

Pros: You can choose from a 9-inch or 10-inch anklet. It also comes in multiple color combinations.

Cons: Some may find it's too short.

This 9-inch anklet is equipped with a bismark chain, lobster claw closure and a 1-inch extender.

Pros: It comes in a convenient carrying pouch. It's also offered in rose and yellow gold finishes.

Cons: Some may prefer a thinner style.

This beaded chain anklet is 9 inches long with a 1-inch extender and features a reliable spring clasp.

Pros: It comes with a free guide on how to keep, store and clean your silver jewelry, and there are eight unique designs to choose from.

Cons: This may also be a bit tight for some.

item.title: These Waterproof Knit Sneakers Will Actually Keep Your Feet Dry
item.author: Allie Fasanella

amzn:product.amzn:productSummary: Sorel’s Out ‘N About Plus sneakers for women are designed to keep feet dry and protected.
These Skechers sneakers for men will keep your socks from getting soggy in wet weather conditions.
These simple unisex sneakers will go with anything and keep your feet dry.

item.content:encoded:
It’s not always ideal to wear clunky rubber boots when it’s wet outside. Enter the water-resistant knit sneaker. A variety of brands offers sneaker styles with waterproof knit constructions that are equipped to keep you dry when its raining cats and dogs. To ensure you find the best pair for your needs, we did some research and rounded up a few of our favorite options for men and women. We included sneakers from well-respected brands like Sorel, Cole Haan and Skechers for you to choose from. Each shoe has a classic lace-up silhouette and breathable uppers so feet don’t get too sweaty.

This Sorel women's style has a waterproof bootie construction with front and rear pull-tabs for convenient on and off.

Pros: A removable, molded PU-like EVA footbed with a textile topcover supplies excellent underfoot comfort. Vulcanized rubber midsoles deliver extra support and shock absorption. Herringbone rubber soles provide stable traction on slippery surfaces. These sneakers are available in several colors.

Cons: These also run somewhat large.

These men's sneakers have a soft woven sock-knit fabric upper treated with advanced Hydro-Knit waterproof technology and leather-textured synthetic side panels for added stability.

Pros: High-traction rubber outsoles are slip and oil resistant. Memory foam insoles provide long-lasting comfort and support.

Cons: Some may find they could have more arch support.

These sneakers have a lightweight, waterproof knit upper that provides adaptive support for the best possible fit.

Pros: Dual front and rear pull tabs allow for easy on and off. They're offered in men and women's sizes.

Cons: They may feel a little hot.

item.title: Rhinestone Anklets Are the Accessories You Didn’t Know You Needed
item.author: Claudia Miller

amzn:product.amzn:productSummary: Drip in (faux) diamonds with Kiokioa’s dazzling anklet.
Loyata’s anklet is an easy way to add charm to your outfit.
Try this elegant style in sapphire for a pop of color at the ankle.

item.content:encoded:
Anklets may have been popular in the ’90s, but they’re making their way into our jewelry boxes again (and rightfully, so). Rhinestone styles can add a subtle dose of glam to basic office outfits or top off polished date-night looks when worn with pumps or heeled slide sandals. Many of today’s styles are prettier than ever, yet aren’t nearly as expensive as they look. Ahead, we’ve rounded up some of our favorite rhinestone-embellished anklets to make you feel like a million bucks. There are both gold and silver options so that you can find a style that suits your preference

Kiokioa's anklet has layered rows of genuine crystals sitting atop a silver-plated base.

Pros: This sleek rhinestone-embellished anklet stretches to fit around your ankle for a personalized fit.

Cons: It may fit larger on smaller ankles.

Loyata makes its anklet with a gold-plated brass chain and dangling cubic zirconium stones.

Pros: This thin chain anklet is adorned with an adjustable clasp and dangling rhinestones for a dainty, subtle pop of charm.

Cons: The chain or gems may get caught in the hem of raw-hem jeans and pants.

NYC Sterling makes this anklet in gold-plated and silver versions with black, sapphire and clear rhinestones for multiple buying options.

Pros: The rhinestones of this anklet make it a fun, colorful accessory that pops on the ankle.

Cons: This anklet may be delicate and can break if pulled too hard.

item.title: Relive Your Summer Camp Days In These Braided Anklets
item.author: Claudia Miller

amzn:product.amzn:productSummary: Layer Fancy Shiny’s anklets for a boho-chic vibe.
Or consider this moonstone anklet.
Brace for the beach in Jeka’s waterproof anklets.

item.content:encoded:
For many of us, the highlight of our childhood summers was making friendship bracelets and anklets with friends, then showing off what we learned at camp about weaving the strings in special ways. To help bring those memories alive again, we found a selection of adorable braided anklets to incorporate into your lineup. Whether you need a waterproof anklet for your upcoming seaside vacation or you are simply looking to add a pop of color to your favorite white sneakers, the following options have you covered. Can’t decide which style you like best? Try wearing a few at the same time for a boho, layered look.

Fancy Shiny's anklets feature dangling silver embellishments and colorful string.

Pros: The braided string in these anklets are wax-coated to protect them from water, sand and more; there are three separate anklets in this pack so you can wear one individually or stack them.

Cons: These have an adjustable band that stretches from 8 to 12 inches, so some may find it hard to find the right fit.

These anklets feature woven wax cords and an opal woven closure.

Pros: This anklet is uniquely wrapped around five opal moonstones for an eye-catching take on a braided anklet.

Cons: The brand states that due to the natural property of the stone and hand-carved nature, each of them might have a difference.

Jeka's anklets are made from woven cotton and wax, coming in a pack of six.

Pros: These colorful anklets are made to withstand the elements so they won't get tarnished or worn from a day at the beach or a sweaty trip to the gym.

Cons: These anklets must be tied for closure and can come loose if not tied properly.
